title: Nouvelle École
text:
Nouvelle École (meaning "New School" in English) is an annual <a href="French-language">French-language</a> political and philosophy magazine which was established by an <a href="ethno-nationalist">ethno-nationalist</a> <a href="think%20tank">think tank</a>, <a href="GRECE">GRECE</a>. The publication is one of the significant media outlets of the <a href="European%20New%20Right">New Right</a> political approach in <a href="France">France</a>. The director of "Nouvelle École", <a href="Alain%20de%20Benoist">Alain de Benoist</a>, stated that the start of the magazine indicates the birth of the New Right.
History and profile.
"Nouvelle École" was launched in 1968 and is directed by Alain de Benoist. The first issue appeared on 11 March 1968. The <a href="editor-in-chief">editor-in-chief</a> of "Nouvelle École" is Eric Maulin. The magazine covers a wide range of topics, including archeology, biology, sociology, literature, philosophy and history of religions. 
<a href="William%20H.%20Tucker%20%28psychologist%29">William H. Tucker</a> and <a href="Bruce%20Lincoln">Bruce Lincoln</a> described "Nouvelle École" as the "French version of the "<a href="Mankind%20Quarterly">Mankind Quarterly</a>"" (a scientific racist journal), and historian James G. Shields as the equivalent of the German scientific racist journal "<a href="Neue%20Anthropologie">Neue Anthropologie</a>".
